---
title: "About This Project"
---

Using the 2917 National Household Travel Survey and my data munging abilities, I have found that mobility is infact different from regular mobility. I could use t-test statistics to compare means, maybe find linear regression applications too.

The 2017 National Household Travel Survey contains data surrounding mobility for users with disabilities, including wheelchairs. Wheelchairs introduce a unique challenge to accessibility in all modes, but most recently to the mode of on-demand ride-hailing....
